Package com.sqlcom.databases

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sqlcom.databases.Database
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatabaseMYSQL
    public abstract class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract Database file is for a generic connection databases.

    • Method Detail

      • updateDbConnection

        public abstract void updateDbConnection()
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method will update the database connection incase any variables are changed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - This will get thrown if the mysql driver is missing.
        java.sql.SQLException - this will get thrown if anything with connecting to the database goes wrong.

      • tryUpdateDbConnection

        private void tryUpdateDbConnection()
        Tries to update DbConnection.

      • execute

        public java.sql.ResultSet execute​(java.lang.String stmt)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This will execute a string sql query.
        Parameters:
        stmt - an SQL statement to be sent to the database, typically a static SQL SELECT statement Javadoc borrowed from the JDBC api under the GPL license.
        Returns:
        returns a hashmap array list with the results of the queries. null if it fails or there is no result. if the query does not return any data it returns a hashmap array with one hashmap index containing a key set called "200"
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - this will get thrown if anything with connecting to the database goes wrong.

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate​(java.lang.String stmt)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given SQL statement, which may be an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as an SQL DDL statement.

        Note:This method cannot be called on a PreparedStatement or CallableStatement. Javadoc borrowed from the JDBC api under the GPL license.

        Parameters:
        stmt - SQL statement, such as INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE; or an SQL statement that returns nothing.
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this method is called on a closed Statement, the given SQL statement produces a ResultSet object, the method is called on a PreparedStatement or CallableStatement
